snippet.title: Block, Blockstream Join With Tesla to Mine Bitcoin in Texas
snippet.description: Blockstream CEO Adam Back joins Emily Chang and Bloomberg's Sonali Basak to talk about the future of crypto and crypto mining as they partner up with Block and Tesla for a new mine and what it means from an energy perspective.

localized.title: Block, Blockstream Join With Tesla to Mine Bitcoin in Texas

snippet.title: Musk's Tesla Cyber Rodeo
snippet.description: Bloomberg's Sean O'Kane joins Emily Chang to talk about Tesla's "Cyber Rodeo," the grand opening event of its newest factory in Austin, Texas - a show packed with production announcements, lots of lighting, car shows, and even some crying.

localized.title: Musk's Tesla Cyber Rodeo
localized.description: Bloomberg's Sean O'Kane joins Emily Chang to talk about Tesla's "Cyber Rodeo," the grand opening event of its newest factory in Austin, Texas - a show packed with production announcements, lots of lighting, car shows, and even some crying.

snippet.title: Shanghai Lockdown Tests China's Zero Covid Policy
snippet.description: Aspen Security Forum Executive Director Anja Manuel joins Emily Chang to discuss the impact of China's lockdowns on its population, its economy, and its tech competitiveness, and how U.S./China relations will evolve as the war in Ukraine rages on.

snippet.title: Power On: Apple's WWDC Goes Virtual Again
snippet.description: Bloomberg's Mark Gurman tells all about why Apple's flagship WWDC event goes online for a third time in a row this year, and what novelties he is expecting to come out of it in spite of its virtual nature.

localized.title: Power On: Apple's WWDC Goes Virtual Again
localized.description: Bloomberg's Mark Gurman tells all about why Apple's flagship WWDC event goes online for a third time in a row this year, and what novelties he is expecting to come out of it in spite of its virtual nature.

snippet.title: SpaceX and NASA Send Four Private Astronauts to Space Station
snippet.description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket carrying four private astronauts lifted off at 11:17 a.m. Eastern time¬†from Kennedy Space Center in Florida. This marks the¬†first private mission¬†to the International Space Station sanctioned by NASA and brings the U.S. space agency one step closer to commercializing low earth orbit. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow reports from Florida on "Bloomberg Markets."

localized.title: SpaceX and NASA Send Four Private Astronauts to Space Station
localized.description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket carrying four private astronauts lifted off at 11:17 a.m. Eastern time¬†from Kennedy Space Center in Florida. This marks the¬†first private mission¬†to the International Space Station sanctioned by NASA and brings the U.S. space agency one step closer to commercializing low earth orbit. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow reports from Florida on "Bloomberg Markets."

snippet.title: SpaceX Launches First Mission With Private Astronauts
snippet.description: Four private astronauts are on a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket heading for the International Space Station. It's the first private mission for Elon Musk's venture. The trip is the first by Axiom Space Inc., a Houston-based startup that plans to assemble a private space station starting in 2024. The rocket took off from Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

snippet.title: Lightning Labs Aims to Make Bitcoin Transfers Faster, Cheaper
snippet.description: Lightning Labs Co-founder and CEO Elizabeth Stark joins Emily Chang and Bloomberg's Sonali Basak from Bitcoin 2022 in Miami to talk about how they are bringing new financing to create a protocol to facilitate fiat currency transfers to Bitcoin. She also shares her views on the growing adoption of crypto, especially in Latin America, and how this technology broadens access to finance for people globally.

localized.title: Lightning Labs Aims to Make Bitcoin Transfers Faster, Cheaper
localized.description: Lightning Labs Co-founder and CEO Elizabeth Stark joins Emily Chang and Bloomberg's Sonali Basak from Bitcoin 2022 in Miami to talk about how they are bringing new financing to create a protocol to facilitate fiat currency transfers to Bitcoin. She also shares her views on the growing adoption of crypto, especially in Latin America, and how this technology broadens access to finance for people globally.

snippet.title: Gen Z Driving the Recommerce Revolution
snippet.description: eBay CEO Jamie Iannone joins Emily Chang on their latest "Recommerce Report" which found that Gen Z consumers are increasingly motivated to sell and buy secondhand goods. He also shares his views on buying and selling secondhand globally, why it has become a growing trend in retail, and how Covid-19 has impacted shopping habits.

snippet.title: Save Money With These Tips to Lower Your Utility Bills
snippet.description:
From handy smart home devices to the best ways to wash your dishes, we've collected a handful of simple tools and tricks you can use to reduce your monthly utility usage.
 
We talk about smart thermostats, light bulbs and energy monitors. We also cover several easy tips that don't involve buying new devices. We want to make your life easier -- you should work smarter, not harder, to get your energy costs down.

snippet.title: Hummer EV first drive: An enormous electric super-truck
snippet.description:

snippet.title: Nikon Z9 review: Speed, resolution and 8K video power
snippet.description:
Nikon‚Äôs Z9 offers a rare combination of speed, resolution and video capability. It‚Äôs the first mirrorless camera without a mechanical shutter, but the sensor is fast enough to minimize any rolling shutter issues. It has Nikon‚Äôs best autofocus system by far, and delivers outstanding image quality. Video is top notch as well, with 8K 30p on tap and 8K 60p RAW coming later this year via firmware update.

snippet.title: GamerdreamZ: Sony shouldn‚Äôt have killed the Vita
snippet.description:
We seem to be undergoing a handheld-gaming renaissance, with the Switch, Steam Deck, Analogue Pocket, Playdate, mobile gaming, and even Microsoft cloud game-streaming. Sony is the one company that's left out, having retired it's beloved-if-not-successful Vita. The Vita may be gone, but it's not forgotten, and we're holding out hope Sony will see what they're missing.

snippet.title: How a year in space changes your body and brain
snippet.description:
After 355 days on the ISS, astronaut Mark Vande Hei has returned to Earth, setting the new record for an American in space. We're just starting to understand how spending time in space changes your body, and staying healthy presents one of the biggest challenges we have to overcome if we want to explore our solar system and the galaxy.

snippet.title: Irma Olguin: CEO & Co-Founder, Bitwise Industries
snippet.description:
This inspirational entrepreneur is building economies in underserved communities around the U.S by democratizing opportunities that technology can provide. Olguin raised one of the largest Series A rounds ever for a female, Latinx-led company, and as CEO and co-founder, she oversees Bitwise's operations teams, tech-focused training programs, and software development. Kevin talks with Irma about resilience, what it takes to overcome adversity, and giving back to your community.¬†¬†¬†

snippet.title: Surface | NFL Superstitions (Playoffs)
snippet.description:
With more than 2,000 Surface devices in the hands of players and coaches, powering 332 NFL games in a year, Surface has become ubiquitous on the sidelines. Superstitions are also ubiquitous with players and coaches, from what socks they wear to how they lace up their shoes to how they prepare for every game. In the end, who knows what superstitions are true, but one thing is undeniably clear ‚Äì Microsoft Surface has the power to change the game.

 

Learn more: https://inculture.microsoft.com/sports/nfl-surface-teams/

snippet.title: Humans and AI: Meet K√ºr≈üat  |  Episode 10
snippet.description:
"Humans and AI tells stories of passionate people from all walks of life, who are using AI to transform our society and our world for the better. 

Approximately 250 million people around the world have a visual impairment. Out of this 250 million, 50 million use a white cane to help with navigation. For years, there have been no changes to technological changes to the white cane. Until now. What happens when we infuse AI technology with white canes? K√ºr≈üat Ceylan first realized the need for an advanced white cane while traveling to New York City. While making his way through the airport, he was trying to hold onto his white cane, his smartphone, and his suitcase when he collided with a pole. The whole world was advancing, so why should people with visual impairments be left behind? He understood the difficulties that came with using a traditional white cane and wants to show people that having a vision impairment should not impede you from pursuing your dreams. So, K√ºr≈üat co-founded WeWALK, an organization that develops smart canes to help improve users‚Äô safety, mobility, and independence. Learn more in our newest Humans and AI story.  

Learn more: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/ai/humans-and-ai-Kursat-Ceylan?OCID=WeWALK_MSBrand_FY22Q3_omc_AIsoc_yt

snippet.title: How To Play DOOM With Ray Tracing!
snippet.description:
Thanks to a talented modder, the original DOOM can now be played with full path tracing enabled! In this video Keith shows off DOOM running with ray tracing enabled and shows you how to set it up yourself. As you'll see, enabling real time shadows like this breaths light into this classic game and is something you have to try yourself. snippet.title: Tested: 3 Generations Of Intel CPUs In The Same Laptop Chassis
snippet.description:
Gordon has had the rare treat of testing 3 generations of Intel CPUs inside of the same laptop design, an MSI GE76 Raider. This gives us one of the best examples of performance improvements between generations since it's hard to test mobile CPUs in isolation. Gordon shows Adam a bunch of charts (like he does) showing the impact the different generations present in everything from CPU benchmarks to gaming. So did you upgrade to 12th-gen? Let us know why in the comments.

snippet.title: GW Studios Event | Restoring Hope: Tackling Healthcare‚Äôs Biggest Challenge Through Collective Action
snippet.description:
Sponsored by Lyn Health
Healthcare is failing the people who need it the most‚Äîthose managing multiple medical- and behavioral health-related conditions. Throughout the coming decade, the number of Americans deemed ‚Äúpolychronic‚Äù will rise exponentially from 34 million in 2021 to more than 83 million in 2030. Disparate and disintegrated clinical solutions, inadequate or insufficient care plans, contributing social factors, and a lack of a human-centric support model all drive these vulnerable populations towards a sense of hopelessness and despair.

In this session panelist discuss how multiple stakeholders across the ecosystem are aligning to tackle urgent issues through collective action, moderated by Andrey Ostrovsky, Founding Chief Medical Officer, Lyn Health.

Panelists included:
‚Ä¢ Sheila Savageau, Global Health and Well-being Leader, General Motors
‚Ä¢ Claire Verity, President of Regence BlueShield of Washington
‚Ä¢ Naomi Allen, Co-founder and CEO, Brightline
‚Ä¢ Rick Abbott, Co-founder and CEO, Lyn Health

Thanks to the session sponsor Lyn Health.

snippet.title: Captured on camera: Coyote vs. cat in Seattle
snippet.description:
Hold on to your cats, Seattle.

It's common these days to see viral videos of people pilfering packages from porches, but an Amazon Ring camera captured a more unusual scene in GeekWire co-founder Todd Bishop's side yard in Seattle's Ballard neighborhood this week: a neighbor's cat leaping for his life, literally, with an urban coyote hot on his tail.

snippet.title: Testing Amazon's cashierless checkout at an NHL game inside Climate Pledge Arena
snippet.description: Amazon‚Äôs cashierless technology made its debut inside Climate Pledge Arena on Saturday during the inaugural Seattle Kraken home game. We had a chance to test out the tech, and it worked seamlessly. Other fans found it similarly easy and convenient. Four food and beverage stores inside the arena are equipped with the ‚ÄúJust Walk Out‚Äù tech that uses cameras and sensors to track customers, and removes the need for human cashiers. It‚Äôs the same experience found in Amazon Go convenience stores and the company‚Äôs Fresh grocery stores.

snippet.title: Why Learning Offensive Security Makes You A Better Defender - Catherine Ullman - ESW #268
snippet.description:
Defensive and Offensive skills have never been mutually exclusive, but the value in training across disciplines has often been overlooked. Catherine joins us today to explain why familiarity with offensive skills, tools, and the attacker's mindset is such a huge benefit for defenders. A few of the highlights we'll cover in this interview include:

- How to get started, learning offensive tools and techniques
- What it means to be an 'Active Defender'
- How to get into the head of the attacker
- How to avoid 'tool-focused tunnel vision'

Visit https://www.securityweekly.com/esw for all the latest episodes!

Show Notes: https://securityweekly.com/esw268

snippet.title: Common Sense Steps for Implementing Shields Up - Josh Snow - ESW #268
snippet.description:
In the recent Shields Up advisory, CISA released guidance advising enterprises to prepare for an influx of malicious cyber activity. The advisory includes best practices for reducing the likelihood of a damaging cyber intrusion and how to detect and respond to potential incidents from nation state-sponsored actors. Josh Snow joins Enterprise Security Weekly to provide additional, practical advice for analysts who are on the front lines of the developing cyber conflict. He will dive into the specific practices and protocols that defenders should shore up, as well as behavioral indicators that signal active exploitation attempts.

snippet.title: Top Penetration Testing Challenges and How to Overcome Them
snippet.description:
A penetration test can be an invaluable tool to evaluate the security of an IT infrastructure by safely trying to exploit vulnerabilities. Despite the necessity for these critical evaluations, many security teams struggle to maximize the effectiveness of pen tests in their organization.

In this webinar, Paul Asadoorian and Matt Alderman will discuss the challenges of penetration testing, including talent, tools, and reporting of findings. Cybersecurity expert Steve Laubenstein, VP of Cyber Threat Security at Core Security, A HelpSystems Company will discuss and offer advice on the biggest struggles they see with penetration testing at different organizations, including: 

Addressing the lack of pen testing talent  
How organizations are leveraging pen testing  
Why penetration testing is important in prioritizing remediation needs  
How red-blue-purple teaming brings value to organizations  
The importance of testing processes, not just infrastructure, apps, and people 
Advocating for a consistent and strategic pen test program

Join this webcast to learn how to tackle these challenges and implement best practices. With thousands of cybersecurity incidents reported by every year, penetration testing is more important than ever to assess your defenses, find security weaknesses, and create a more robust security posture. 

‚ÜíVisit our website: https://www.securityweekly.com
‚ÜíFollow us on Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/securityweekly
‚ÜíLike us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/secweekly

#SecurityWeekly #PenetrationTesting #Cybersecurity

snippet.title: Closing the Cybersecurity Workforce Gap
snippet.description:
We know there are many job openings in cybersecurity today. We struggle to find the right people for the right job. But who are the right people? What are the right jobs? Whether you are hiring or pursuing a career in information security join this webcast for our take on how to build the right skills and acquire the right talent in cybersecurity today! Our friends at (ISC)¬≤ have compiled the most comprehensive study we‚Äôve seen on this topic. 

The 2018 (ISC)¬≤ Cybersecurity Workforce Study (formerly the Global Information Security Workforce Study) is based on feedback from a broader, more representative sample of the men and women responsible for securing their organizations around the world. This includes many IT/ICT staff within organizations ranging from large enterprises to small businesses who may or may not have formal cybersecurity roles but do have hands-on responsibility for securing critical assets every day ‚Äì spending at least 25% of their time on such activities. Their views and opinions create a more realistic representation of the cybersecurity challenges and opportunities the industry faces around the globe.    

‚ÜíVisit our website: https://www.securityweekly.com
‚ÜíFollow us on Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/securityweekly
‚ÜíLike us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/secweekly

#SecurityWeekly #Cybersecurity #Hiring

snippet.title: Evaluating Security Vendors without Losing Your Mind
snippet.description:
Trying to figure out which security solutions work for you is a frustrating process. Getting your organization to agree on goals and expected outcomes, trying to understand what all the different vendor products ACTUALLY do, and testing the solution in some capacity is a daunting process. Many get lost somewhere along the way, and either end up with the wrong solution, not using what has been purchased, or not implementing anything at all! Paul and Adrian have been on the forefront of this struggle for some time and have come together to offer advice, strategies and tactics to make your purchase decisions easier.  

Learn:
How to figure out which security solutions work for you 
Explore ways to define your goals 
Cut through the vendor noise 
Properly evaluate products 

How to avoid ending up with the wrong solution, not using what has been purchased, or not implementing anything at all 
‚ÜíVisit our website: https://www.securityweekly.com
‚ÜíFollow us on Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/securityweekly
‚ÜíLike us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/secweekly

#SecurityWeekly #SecurityVendors #Evaluation

snippet.title: Aligning Security Solutions with the MITRE ATT&CK Framework
snippet.description:
The MITRE ATT&CK framework is quickly becoming a focal point in the security world ‚Äî and for good reason. This framework provides a consistent, industry-wide standard on which you can assess the effectiveness of your security monitoring and alerting capabilities. Paul Asadoorian and Matt Alderman will provide an overview of the MITRE ATT&CK framework, discuss how to prioritize the capabilities in this framework, and reviews some of the existing open source tools for testing/mapping to MITRE. 

Then, Brian Coulson and Dan Kaiser from LogRhythm will discuss how to align the MITRE ATT&ACK framework with a SIEM platform, including the following techniques: 

¬∑      T1090 ‚Äì Connection Proxy 
¬∑      T1048 ‚Äì Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol 
¬∑      T1036 ‚Äì Masquerading 
¬∑      T1189 ‚Äì Drive By Compromise 
¬∑      T1035 ‚Äì Service Execution 

‚ÜíVisit our website: https://www.securityweekly.com
‚ÜíFollow us on Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/securityweekly
‚ÜíLike us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/secweekly

#SecurityWeekly #MITRE #InformationSecurity

snippet.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture's 1/6 Scale Figures!
snippet.description:
We're back in studio with Exo-6's founder and director Schubert Tam to geek out about his passion for Star Trek and one-sixth scale figures. Today, we take a look at production samples for Kirk and Spock from Star Trek: The Motion Picture, and discuss the revelations about the color and patterning of these costumes that were uncovered in order to accurately recreate them at small scale. 

Learn more about Exo-6's figures at https://exo-6.com/

Shot and edited by Norman Chan

snippet.title: The Making of Modern Star Trek Figures
snippet.description:
As the Star Trek: Mission Chicago convention kicks off this weekend, we're visited in-studio by Exo-6, the makers of new one-sixth scale Star Trek figures from every series in the franchise. We chat with Exo-6's founder Schubert Tam about his direction and design for the company's figures, capturing the likeness of actors in iconic roles, and the challenge of replicating Star Trek's costumes and uniforms at this scale. 

Learn more about Exo-6's figures at https://exo-6.com/

Shot and edited by Norman Chan

snippet.title: Adam Savage's One Day Builds: Vintage Bicycle Restoration!
snippet.description:
Mythbusters fans may recognize the subject of today's One Day Build: the cruiser that Tory Belleci rode and wiped out on while attempting a jump. It's actually a bicycle that Adam has owned since the early 90s, and he restores it to the riding condition it was in when he used to use it as a commuting bike to work at ILM! Don't worry--no jumps attempted here!

Watch MythBusters on Discovery Plus: https://discoveryplus.com/
Adam's T-shirt: https://cottonbureau.com/products/empathy-kindness-respect#/

It's actually a bicycle that Adam has owned since the early 90s, and he restores it to the riding condition it was in when he used to use it as a commuting bike to work at ILM! Don't worry--no jumps attempted here!

Watch MythBusters on Discovery Plus: https://discoveryplus.com/
Adam's T-shirt: https://cottonbureau.com/products/empathy-kindness-respect#/

Shot and edited by Joey Fameli

snippet.title: How to Make Fake Concrete Sidewalks for Dioramas!
snippet.description:
Kayte and Norm return for a new season of Model Behavior modelmaking videos, and kick things off this year with a tutorial demonstrating how to make realistic scale-miniature concrete sidewalks! Using insulation foam sheets and household materials, here's how to quickly fabricate panels that can be used for your figure or diorama displays. 

XPS Foam sheets: https://amzn.to/3J8Uuon
Vaelljo dipping wash: https://amzn.to/35EuLWL

snippet.title: Adam Savage's Apocalypse Now Kurtz Dossier Replica Project!
snippet.description:
Adam shares a replica project that he worked on for over three years--a perfect replica of the Kurtz Dossier from Apocalypse Now! Created and compiled in collaboration with a member of the Replica Prop Forum, this collection of bespoke documents and screen-accurate ephemera was meticulously replicated, down to the stationary and embossed materials fabricated just for this prop. And did you notice that the pool table is now gone from the cave? 

TheRPF threads for this project: https://www.therpf.com/forums/threads/kurtz-dossier.118920/ https://www.therpf.com/forums/threads/the-adam-savage-complete-kurtz-dossier-replica-project.282825/

snippet.title: Adam Savage's One Day Builds: James Bond's Spectre Cane!
snippet.description:
Adam tackles a prop replica project that's been sitting on his workbench for months! Last year, he bought a beautiful cast metal cane topper that's a replica of the one used by James Bond in the film Spectre. Adam finally completes that replica with a fully custom wooden cane shaft turned from a long piece of walnut. From slowly sanding the wood down to give it a gentle taper to machining and fitting the ferrule tip, it's a painstaking build that yields a truly satisfying hand prop to hold!

Factory Entertainment James Bond Cane: https://www.factoryent.com/James-Bond-SPECTRE-Day-Of-The-Dead-Skull-Cane-p/408267.htm

Shot by Adam Savage and edited by Norman Chan

snippet.title: LED Lighting for Miniatures and Dioramas!
snippet.description:
Jen and Norm examine different techniques for using LED lights to illuminate small-scale scenes, using Jen's laser-cut diorama as a model for lighting experimentation. From uplighting behind silhouetted shapes to diffused lighting inside buildings, here are a few different ways Jen is using lighting to give mood and depth to her miniature displays. 

Find more of Jen's project on her website at https://www.jenschachter.com/

‚Ä¢ ¬†Windows 11 will add a watermark on your desktop if your hardware isn't supported

Cloud

‚Ä¢ Report: Microsoft Expects Negative Feedback About Military HoloLens

‚Ä¢ ¬†Surface Duo and AMD-based Surface Laptop 3 Get New Firmware Updates
‚Ä¢ ¬†Dynabook Announces New Tecra Laptops
‚Ä¢ ¬†The Future of Computing is ‚Ä¶ a Tablet? (Premium)

‚Ä¢ ¬†FTC Requests More Information from Microsoft and Activision Blizzard
‚Ä¢ ¬†Xbox Cloud Gaming Adds Steam Deck Support via Microsoft Edge
‚Ä¢ ¬†Google Has a New Strategy for Stadia (Premium)

Tips and Picks
‚Ä¢ ¬†Tip of the week: Decision time
‚Ä¢ ¬†A few weeks back I said it was time to check out the Dev channel. Well, Microsoft just gave you an out. Should you take it?
‚Ä¢ ¬†App pick of the week: Greenshot
‚Ä¢ ¬†This is the best screenshot utility for Windows, period. I rely on it every day.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Enterprise pick of the week: Microsoft Translator gets an AI boost
‚Ä¢ ¬†Z-code, Mixture of Experts and lots of other AI ‚Äúmagic‚Äù is improving Translator and other Azure services, MS says
‚Ä¢ ¬†Enterprise pick no. 2 of the week: You say you want to learn cybersecurity‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ ¬†Microsoft expands its skilling campaign for cybersecurity experts to 23 countries
‚Ä¢ ¬†Beer pick of the week: Resolve Freedom Kellerbier
‚Ä¢ ¬†The Global Empowerment Mission (GEM) is a designated not-for-profit for the Resolve collaboration beer. GEM is providing emergency aid inside Ukraine to the fighters and families that have stayed behind, as well as humanitarian aid to the women and children that are trying to cross the border into Poland.

snippet.title: LF Live Webinar: Top Three Benefits for Enterprises Transitioning to Smart Cloud-Native Now
snippet.description:
sponsored by D2iQ

Smart Cloud-Native is powering digital innovation and transforming the way enterprises are doing business. While every new technology introduces risks and rewards, the world is moving to smart-cloud native because of its numerous advantages. Join us for this webinar, an exploration of the top benefits of transitioning to Smart Cloud-Native and how cloud-native + AI can improve your business results and make the world a better place.

What you will learn:
- Why the world is moving to smart-cloud native apps.
- How the collective wisdom of the open-source community is the clear choice to bring smart cloud-native AI innovation into the mainstream.
- Why businesses must act now if they want to compete.
- Why digital experiences that are powered by AI and are self-improving will be the defining attributes of the next generation of winning products in all industries.

Speakers:
- Tobi Knaup, CEO, D2iQ
- Joe Taborek, President, D2iQ

snippet.title: The Most Widely Used Open Source Projects:  Census II of Free and Open Source Software
snippet.description: The Linux Foundation, in collaboration with Harvard‚Äôs Lab for Innovation Science, recently published Census II of Free and Open Source Software‚ÄîApplication Libraries, the second investigation into the widespread use of Free and Open Source Software (FOSS). The report identifies more than 1,000 of the most widely deployed open source application libraries. To deep dive into the latest report, what questions it aims to answer, how it informs actions to sustain the long-term security and health of FOSS, we hosted Frank Nagle, Assistant Professor at Harvard Business School.

snippet.title: LF Live Webinar: Kubernetes Observability with OpenTelemetry and Beyond
snippet.description:
sponsored by Instana

How do Kubernetes requests and limits factor in when you are observing what‚Äôs happening in your Kubernetes cluster? What are the different scaling approaches? What can you actually scale? We are going to review all these concepts and learn some best practices you can apply in your environment. We‚Äôll also discuss how much easier life is when an observability tool reminds you how many workloads you can allocate and what‚Äôs consuming your resources.

In the second half of this webinar, we‚Äôll take a look at how to instrument your workloads and analyze the signals in a third-party system. We‚Äôll show some code and take a look at a live polyglot microservice application for illustration.

Observing resources and applications in Kubernetes is hard‚Ä¶ But it doesn‚Äôt have to be! OpenTelemetry is a standard under CNCF governance, and it can greatly reduce the burden of observing applications and services provisioned in Kubernetes clusters.

After attending the webinar, you‚Äôll have deeper insights into:

- Managing and observing resource usage in Kubernetes
- Observing Kubernetes workloads with open standards

snippet.title: LF Live Webinar: Responding To Threats In AWS Linux & Kubernetes Environments
snippet.description:
sponsored by Cado Security

The cloud is complex. Data can be extremely difficult to access, or worse, disappear in the blink of an eye. While the ephemeral nature of cloud environments often makes an investigation seem like an impossible task, automation flips the script. By automating the most tedious parts of an in-depth investigation, including data capture and processing, analysts can get to the bottom of what happened without delays or headaches. Join us to discuss real-life attack techniques used to compromise AWS Linux and Kubernetes environments and how to gain the level of visibility and depth that‚Äôs required to respond to cloud incidents most efficiently.

snippet.title: Steam Deck is a glorious mess
snippet.description:
The Steam Deck is a Linux handheld gaming PC that runs Windows games like a Nintendo Switch, and it‚Äôs damn good at it ‚Äì when it works. But the half-baked console gave us a lot of trouble, and we don‚Äôt review gadgets on promise!  Here‚Äôs why Sean Hollister thinks it‚Äôs more like an OG Game Boy than a Nintendo Switch, transformative despite not yet meeting its potential.

snippet.title: Galaxy S22 Ultra review: duly noted
snippet.description:
The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra is a worthy Note successor in just about every way. With a built-in S Pen stylus, excellent camera system, improved portrait mode, and top-notch performance, it looks and acts every bit like the $1,199 flagship that it is. Features like an enhanced Raw capture mode have niche appeal, but the whole thing adds up to a phone that‚Äôs unlike anything else on the market.

snippet.title: The Kids Are Alright - Wyze camera flaw, E3 is over again, Dorsey apologizes for centralized web
snippet.description:
Wyze camera flaw, E3 is over again, Dorsey apologizes for centralized web¬†
‚Ä¢ Wyze knew hackers could remotely access your camera for three years and said nothing.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Lapsus$: Two UK teenagers charged with hacking for gang.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Lapsus$ and SolarWinds hackers both use the same old trick to bypass MFA.
‚Ä¢ ¬†E3 2022 - Digital and Physical - Has Officially Been Canceled.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Sony merges PS Now and PS Plus to create a three-tier subscription service.
‚Ä¢ ¬†There Are Only 2 Million Units Of Bitcoin Left To Mine -- Why Does It Matter?
‚Ä¢ ¬†Ubiquiti seeks $425 million in damages against industry blogger Brian Krebs.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Apple Is First Streamer to Win the Best Picture Oscar for ‚ÄòCODA‚Äô.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Tim Cook‚Äôs Oscar Moment Didn‚Äôt Come Cheap.
‚Ä¢ ¬†The guest's current WFH status.
‚Ä¢ ¬†At GitHub You Don‚Äôt Need No Stinkin‚Äô Office, But There Is A Nice One If You Do.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Apple is at its best when it doesn‚Äôt know best.
‚Ä¢ ¬†32" M8 UHD/4K Smart Monitor with Streaming TV and SlimFit Camera.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Above Avalon: Apple Is in a League of Its Own.
‚Ä¢ Intel Core i3-12100 and i5-12400 review: Fast, affordable, and hard to criticize.
‚Ä¢ Jack Dorsey regrets his role in creating a centralized internet.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Facebook paid a Republican strategy firm to malign TikTok.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Waymo says fully driverless rides are coming to San Francisco.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Elon Musk on Twitter: There will come a time in the future where people will be surprised that we let practically anyone drive a 2 ton death machine anywhere they want.
‚Ä¢ ¬†Dyson‚Äôs bizarre new headphones have a built-in air purifier.

snippet.title: Using Deep Mind in Archeology: DTNS Science News Monthly 6
snippet.description:
Monthly Science News is here! Our science correspondent Niki goes over the major science stories from March 2022 including CT scans of aquatic dinosaur bones to see how well they might have floated, archeologists using Google AI to restore old inscriptions and text, and how a paralyzed man used a brain-computer interface to communicate with the outside world.

Hosted by Nicole Ackermans

snippet.title: Twitter's Unmentionables - DTNS 4250
snippet.description:
The DFW airport partners with Steer Tech to pilot an automated valet parking. Twitter rolls out several new features. Researchers at Washington State University have developed for neuromorphic computing using honey. During its Austin plant Tesla announced the Cybertruck and the Optimus robot will go on sale in 2023.

Starring Tom Merritt, Sarah Lane, Justin Robert Young, Roger Chang, Joe.

Meta is developing in-app tokens for their virtual properties and testing ways NFTs can be used to validate membership in Facebook groups. Nike plans to open a technology center in Atlanta next year. And MLB approves the PitchCom system to let catchers send directions to their pitchers electronically.

Starring Tom Merritt, Sarah Lane, Nica Montford , Roger Chang, Joe.
